summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel regarding the transfer of three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case. The emails discuss logistics for delivering the drives to a forensic examiner, coordinating with the SDNY, and express urgency due to the case's high-profile nature.

persons.name: Frank
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the coordination of hard drive transfers for the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Hard Drive Transfer
events.description: FBI personnel coordinate the delivery of three 2TB external hard drives to a forensic examiner for processing in the Epstein case, with plans to subsequently provide them to the SDNY.

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case were being transferred between FBI personnel on October 9, 2020.
The drives were intended for forensic examination before being provided to the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The email chain indicates a sense of urgency, noting 'Given the attention this case is getting... we want to ensure there are no delays/issues.'
One FBI personnel member mentioned being 'OCONUS' (outside the continental US) the following week on this case.
